intro: Scutellaria indica var. indica, commonly known as Indian skullcap, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring square stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, with two lips, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
